title: Schema for an Open Contracting Release

ocid.title: Open Contracting ID
ocid.description: A globally unique identifier for this Open Contracting Process. Composed of a publisher prefix and an identifier for the contracting process. For more information see the [Open Contracting Identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/)

id.title: Release ID
id.description: An identifier for this particular release of information. A release identifier must be unique within the scope of it's related contracting process (defined by a common ocid), and unique within any release package it appears in. A release identifier must not contain the # character.

date.title: Release Date
date.description: The date this information is released, it may well be the same as the parent publishedDate, it must not be later than the publishedDate from the parent package. It is used to determine merge order.

tag.title: Release Tag
tag.description: A value from the [releaseTag codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#release-tag) that identifies the nature of the release being made. Tags may be used to filter release, or, in future, for advanced validation when certain kinds of releases should contain certain fields.

initiationType.title: Initiation type
initiationType.description: String specifying the type of initiation process used for this contract, taken from the [initiationType](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#initiation-type) codelist. Currently only tender is supported.

title.title: Title
title.description: A overall title for this contracting process or release.

description.title: Title
description.description: An overall description for this contracting process or release. This should not replace provision of a detailed breakdown of the objects of the contracting process in the planning, tender, award or contracts section.

parties.title: Parties
parties.description: Information on the parties (organisations, economic operators and other participants) who are involved in the contracting process and their roles, e.g. buyer, procuring entity, supplier etc. Organization references elsewhere in the schema are used to refer back to this entries in this list.

planning.title: Planning
planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. This includes information related to the process of deciding what to contract for, when and how.

tender.title: Tender
tender.description: The activities undertaken in order to enter into a contract.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The buyer is the entity whose budget will be used to purchase the goods. This may be different from the procuring agency who may be specified in the tender data.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: Information from the award phase of the contracting process. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

contracts.title: Contracts
contracts.description: Information from the contract creation phase of the procurement process.

language.title: Release language
language.description: Specifies the default language of the data using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended.

relatedProcesses.description: If this process follows on from one or more prior process, represented under a separate open contracting identifier (ocid) then details of the related process can be provided here. This is commonly used to relate mini-competitions to their parent frameworks, full tenders to a pre-qualification phase, or individual tenders to a broad planning process.
relatedProcesses.title: Related processes

bids.title: Bids
bids.description: The bid section is used to publish summary statistics, and where applicable, individual bid information.

buyerInternalReferenceId.title: Buyer Internal Reference Identifier
buyerInternalReferenceId.description: The buyer internal reference identifier is an EU specific field. It uniquely identifies a procurement process within the Buyer's internal system.

hasPreviousNotice.title: Has previous notice?
hasPreviousNotice.description: A True or False field to indicate whether this release represents a TED notice that is connected to a previous notice, either TED or national. Required by EU.

purposeOfNotice.title: Purpose Of Notice
purposeOfNotice.description: Details about the purpose of this notice release - used to determine the fields in the notice that are required to be completed. Required by EU.

relatedNotice.title: Related notice
relatedNotice.description: Information that connects a notice with a related notice for the contracting process.

Planning.title: Planning
Planning.description: Information from the planning phase of the contracting process. Note that many other fields may be filled in a planning release, in the appropriate fields in other schema sections, these would likely be estimates at this stage e.g. totalValue in tender

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The rationale for the procurement provided in free text. More detail can be provided in an attached document.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: A list of documents related to the planning process.

milestones.title: Planning milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the planning stage.

Tender.title: Tender
Tender.description: Data regarding tender process - publicly inviting prospective contractors to submit bids for evaluation and selecting a winner or winners.

id.title: Tender ID
id.description: An identifier for this tender process. This may be the same as the ocid, or may be drawn from an internally held identifier for this tender.

description.title: Tender description
description.description: Tender description

status.title: Tender status
status.description: The current status of the tender based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#tender-status)

items.title: Items to be procured
items.description: The goods and services to be purchased, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but a quantity of 2 specified instead.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The minimum estimated value of the procurement. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

value.title: Value
value.description: The total upper estimated value of the procurement. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

procurementMethod.title: Procurement method
procurementMethod.description: Specify tendering method against the [method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#method) as per [GPA definitions](http://www.wto.org/english/docs_e/legal_e/rev-gpr-94_01_e.htm) of Open, Selective, Limited

procurementMethodDetails.title: Procurement method details
procurementMethodDetails.description: Additional detail on the procurement method used. This field may be used to provide the local name of the particular procurement method used.

procurementMethodRationale.title: Procurement method rationale
procurementMethodRationale.description: Rationale of procurement method, especially in the case of Limited tendering.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Main procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the main object of this contracting process from the [procurementCategory](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#procurement-category) codelist. This is a closed codelist. Local classifications should be mapped to this list.

additionalProcurementCategories.title: Additional procurement categories
additionalProcurementCategories.description: Any additional categories which describe the objects of this contracting process, from the [extendedProcurementCategory](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#extended-procurement-category) codelist. This is an open codelist. Local categories can be included in this list.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Specify the award criteria for the procurement, using the [award criteria codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#award-criteria)

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

submissionMethod.title: Submission method
submissionMethod.description: Specify the method by which bids must be submitted, in person, written, or electronic auction. Using the [submission method codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-method)

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the submission method. This may include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids should be submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions.

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when the tender is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for tender submissions.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification to the entity managing procurement. Details of how to submit enquiries should be provided in attached notices, or in submissionMethodDetails. Structured dates for when responses to questions will be made can be provided using tender milestones.

hasEnquiries.title: Has enquiries?
hasEnquiries.description: A true/false field to indicate whether any enquiries were received during the tender process. Structured information on enquiries that were received, and responses to them, can be provided using the enquiries extension.

enquiries.title: enquiries
enquiries.description: Enquiries array to tender, consisting of one or more enquiry objects, each with fields for a question, and an answer.

eligibilityCriteria.title: Eligibility criteria
eligibilityCriteria.description: A description of any eligibility criteria for potential suppliers.

awardPeriod.title: Evaluation and award period
awardPeriod.description: The period for adjudication and selection of the contract award. The end date should be the date on which an award is due to be finalised. The start date may be used to indicate the start of an evaluation period.

contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or required to be active. If the tender does not specify explicit dates, the duration field may be used.
contractPeriod.title: Contract period

numberOfTenderers.title: Number of tenderers
numberOfTenderers.description: The number of entities who submit a tender.

tenderers.title: Tenderers
tenderers.description: All entities who submit a bid on a tender. More detailed information on bids and the bidding organisation can be provided using the optional bid extension.

procuringEntity.title: Procuring entity
procuringEntity.description: The entity managing the procurement, which may be different from the buyer who is paying / using the items being procured.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the tender, including any notices. See the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#document-type) for details of potential documents to include.

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the tender.

amendments.description: A tender amendment is a formal change to the tender, and generally involves the publication of a new tender notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the ammendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an ammendments (plural) array.

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process may be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features can then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLot identifier is given, the values should be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Properties of tender can be overridden for a given Lot through their inclusion in the Lot object.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: ere the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

criteria.description: A list of criteria on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

acceleratedProcedure.title: Accelerated Procedure
acceleratedProcedure.description: Details about whether an accelerated procurement is being used and the justification for doing so.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The primary classification for the tender. Required by the EU. Uses CPV Codelist See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme).

designContest.title: Tender design contest
designContest.description: The tender takes the form of a design contest. Fields that relate specifically to the design contest are modelled here. Required by the EU

electronicWorkflows.title: Tender economic workflows
electronicWorkflows.description: Details about economic workflows: ordering, invoicing and payments and whether they will be used and/or accepted. Required by the EU

jointProcurement.title: Joint Procurement details
jointProcurement.description: Details about a joint procurement. Required by the EU

legalBasis.title: Tender legal basis
legalBasis.description: The legal basis of the tender based on the [legalBasis codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/......

Objectives.title: Tender objectives
Objectives.description: Details about the tender's objectives: environmental, social and/or for innovation. Required by the EU

procedureOutsourcing.title: Procedure Outsourcing
procedureOutsourcing.description: Whether the procurement procedure has been outsourced. If it has then a record of the organisation that is running the procedure on behalf of the buyer

procurementMethodAdditionalInfo.title: Procurement method additional information
procurementMethodAdditionalInfo.description: Additional information about the procurement method.

reviewParties.title: Organizations involved in the review procedure of the tender
reviewParties.description: The organizations involved in the review procedure for the procurement procedure. Required by the EU and UNCITRAL

reviewPeriod.title: Review period
reviewPeriod.description: The period during which the decision of the procuring entity to award a contract can be challenged.

standstillPeriod.title: Standstill period
standstillPeriod.description: The duration of the applicable standstill period following a challenge or appeal of decisions or actions taken by the procuring entity that are allegedly not in compliance with the provisions of the Law

submissionLanguages.title: Submission Languages
submissionLanguages.description: Language(s) in which tenderers may submit, drawn from the [submissionLanguages codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#submission-languages)

submissionMethodRationale.title: Submisson Method Rationale
submissionMethodRationale.description: A value from the [submissionValueRationale codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/submission-method-rationale) that identifies the rationale where electronic submission method is not to be allowed. Required by EU.

dynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic Purchasing System
dynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Existence of a dynamic purchasing system and whether it may be used by buyers outside the notice. Required by EU.

framework.title: Framework
framework.description: The details of any framework agreement established as part of this procurement. Required by EU.

requiresElectronicCatalogue.title: Requires Electronic Catalogue
requiresElectronicCatalogue.description: Tenders must include an electronic catalogue. Required by the EU

Award.title: Award
Award.description: An award for the given procurement. There may be more than one award per contracting process e.g. because the contract is split amongst different providers, or because it is a standing offer.

id.title: Award ID
id.description: The identifier for this award. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.title: Description
description.description: Award description

status.title: Award status
status.description: The current status of the award drawn from the [awardStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#award-status)

date.title: Award date
date.description: The date of the contract award. This is usually the date on which a decision to award was made.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this award. In the case of a framework contract this may be the total estimated lifetime value, or maximum value, of the agreement. There may be more than one award per procurement. A negative value indicates that the award may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

suppliers.title: Suppliers
suppliers.description: The suppliers awarded this award. If different suppliers have been awarded different items of values, these should be split into separate award blocks.

items.title: Items awarded
items.description: The goods and services awarded in this award, broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period for which the contract has been awarded.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the award, including any notices.

amendments.description: An award amendment is a formal change to the details of the award, and generally involves the publication of a new award notice/release. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the ammendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an ammendments (plural) array.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this award relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

reviewProceedings.title: Award review proceedings
reviewProceedings.description: Details about any application for a review of the award. Required by the EU

statusDetails.title: Status details
statusDetails.description: Additional details of an award status.

Contract.title: Contract
Contract.description: Information regarding the signed contract between the buyer and supplier(s).

id.title: Contract ID
id.description: The identifier for this contract. It must be unique and cannot change within its Open Contracting Process (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

awardID.title: Award ID
awardID.description: The award.id against which this contract is being issued.

extendsContractID.title: Extends contract ID
extendsContractID.description: If this contract extends or amends a previously issued contract, then the contract.id value for the extended/amended contract can be provided here.

description.title: Contract description
description.description: Contract description

status.title: Contract status
status.description: The current status of the contract. Drawn from the [contractStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#contract-status)

period.title: Period
period.description: The start and end date for the contract.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this contract. A negative value indicates that the contract will involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

items.title: Items contracted
items.description: The goods, services, and any intangible outcomes in this contract. Note: If the items are the same as the award do not repeat.

dateSigned.title: Date signed
dateSigned.description: The date the contract was signed. In the case of multiple signatures, the date of the last signature.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the contract, including any notices.

implementation.title: Implementation
implementation.description: Information related to the implementation of the contract in accordance with the obligations laid out therein.

relatedProcesses.description: If this process is followed by one or more contracting processes, represented under a separate open contracting identifier (ocid) then details of the related process can be provided here. This is commonly used to point to subcontracts, or to renewal and replacement processes for this contract.
relatedProcesses.title: Related processes

milestones.title: Contract milestones
milestones.description: A list of milestones associated with the finalisation of this contract.

amendments.description: A contract amendment is a formal change to, or extension of, a contract, and generally involves the publication of a new contract notice/release, or some other documents detailing the change. The rationale and a description of the changes made can be provided here.
amendments.title: Amendments

amendment.title: Amendment
amendment.description: The use of individual amendment objects has been deprecated. From OCDS 1.1 information should be provided in the ammendments array.

deprecated.description: The single amendment object has been deprecated in favour of including amendments in an ammendments (plural) array.

countryOfOrigin.title: Country of Origin
countryOfOrigin.description: Country of origin of the product or service. Required by EU.

lotVariant.title: Lot Variant
lotVariant.description: The contract was awarded to a tenderer who submitted a variant for the following lot(s)

valueBreakdown.title: Value Breakdown
valueBreakdown.description: The breakdown of known and/or estimated values in this contract.

isFrameworkOrDynamic.title: Is Framework Or Dynamic?
isFrameworkOrDynamic.description: Contracts within a framework agreement or a dynamic purchasing system are being awarded. Required by the EU

Implementation.title: Implementation
Implementation.description: Information during the performance / implementation stage of the contract.

transactions.title: Transactions
transactions.description: A list of the spending transactions made against this contract

milestones.title: Milestones
milestones.description: As milestones are completed, milestone completions should be documented.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: Documents and reports that are part of the implementation phase e.g. audit and evaluation reports.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this milestone, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a milestone through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

type.title: Milestone type
type.description: The type of milestone, drawn from an extended [milestoneType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-type).

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the milestone.

code.title: Milestone code
code.description: Milestone codes can be used to track specific events that take place for a particular kind of contracting process. For example, a code of 'approvalLetter' could be used to allow applications to understand this milestone represents the date an approvalLetter is due or signed. Milestone codes is an open codelist, and codes should be agreed amoungst data producers and the applications using that data.

dueDate.title: Due date
dueDate.description: The date the milestone is due.

dateMet.title: Date met
dateMet.description: The date on which the milestone was met.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: The date the milestone was last reviewed or modified and the status was altered or confirmed to still be correct.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status that was realized on the date provided in dateModified, drawn from the [milestoneStatus codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#milestone-status).

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: List of documents associated with this milestone.

deprecated.description: Inclusion of documents at the milestone level is now deprecated. Documentation should be attached in the tender, award, contract or implementation sections, and titles and descriptions used to highlight the related milestone. Publishers who wish to continue to provide documents at the milestone level should explicitly declare this by using the milestone documents extension.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this milestone relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

relatedParties.title: Related Parties
relatedParties.description: Parties that have a relationship with the milestone.

Document.title: Document
Document.description: Links to, or descriptions of, external documents can be attached at various locations within the standard. Documents may be supporting information, formal notices, downloadable forms, or any other kind of resource that should be made public as part of full open contracting.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local, unique identifier for this document. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a document through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

documentType.title: Document type
documentType.description: A classification of the document described taken from the [documentType codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#document-type). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of the document. We recommend descriptions do not exceed 250 words. In the event the document is not accessible online, the description field can be used to describe arrangements for obtaining a copy of the document.

url.title: URL
url.description: direct link to the document or attachment. The server providing access to this document should be configured to correctly report the document mime type.

datePublished.title: Date published
datePublished.description: The date on which the document was first published. This is particularly important for legally important documents such as notices of a tender.

dateModified.title: Date modified
dateModified.description: Date that the document was last modified

format.title: Format
format.description: The format of the document taken from the [IANA Media Types code list](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/), with the addition of one extra value for 'offline/print', used when this document entry is being used to describe the offline publication of a document. Use values from the template column. Links to web pages should be tagged 'text/html'.

language.title: Language
language.description: Specifies the language of the linked document using either two-digit [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is strongly recommended unless there is a clear user need for distinguishing the language subtype.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this document relates to a particular lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

Budget.title: Budget information
Budget.description: This section contain information about the budget line, and associated projects, through which this contracting process is funded. It draws upon data model of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/), and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Budget Data Package, or, where no linked Budget Data Package is available, to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with another published source of budget and project information.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for the budget line item which provides funds for this contracting process. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source.

description.title: Budget Source
description.description: A short free text description of the budget source. May be used to provide the title of the budget line, or the programme used to fund this project.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The value of the budget line item. A negative value indicates anticipated income to the budget as a result of this contracting process, rather than expenditure.

project.title: Project title
project.description: The name of the project that through which this contracting process is funded (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the name by which the project is known in that registry. No translation option is offered for this string, as translated values can be provided in third-party data, linked from the data source above.

projectID.title: Project identifier
projectID.description: An external identifier for the project that this contracting process forms part of, or is funded via (if applicable). Some organizations maintain a registry of projects, and the data should use the identifier from the relevant registry of projects.

uri.title: Linked budget information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about the budget line-item or line-items that fund this contracting process. Information may be provided in a range of formats, including using IATI, the Open Fiscal Data Standard or any other standard which provides structured data on budget sources. Human readable documents can be included using the planning.documents block.

source.title: Data Source
source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Budget Data Package, or to a machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

deprecated.description: The budget data source field was intended to link to machine-readable data about the budget for a contracting process, but has been widely mis-used to provide free-text descriptions of budget providers. As a result, it has been removed from version 1.1. budget/uri can be used to provide a link to machine-readable budget information, and budget/description can be used to provide human-readable information on the budget source.

europeanUnionFunding.title: European Union Funded
europeanUnionFunding.description: Details where a procurement has partial or full financing from a European funded project

isEuropeanUnionFunded.title: Is European Union Funded
isEuropeanUnionFunded.description: A True or False field to indicate whether this procurement is related to a project and/or programme financed by European Union funds.

Transaction.title: Transaction information
Transaction.description: A spending transaction related to the contracting process. Draws upon the data models of the [Fiscal Data Package](http://fiscal.dataprotocols.org/) and the [International Aid Transpareny Initiative](http://iatistandard.org/activity-standard/iati-activities/iati-activity/transaction/) and should be used to cross-reference to more detailed information held using a Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or to provide enough information to allow a user to manually or automatically cross-reference with some other published source of transactional spending data.

id.title: ID
id.description: A unique identifier for this transaction. This identifier should be possible to cross-reference against the provided data source. For IATI this is the transaction reference.

source.title: Data source
source.description: Used to point either to a corresponding Fiscal Data Package, IATI file, or machine or human-readable source where users can find further information on the budget line item identifiers, or project identifiers, provided here.

payer.title: Payer
payer.description: An organization reference for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate.

payee.title: Payee
payee.description: An organization reference for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction.

uri.title: Linked spending information
uri.description: A URI pointing directly to a machine-readable record about this spending transaction.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: The value of the transaction. A negative value indicates a refund or correction.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the ```transaction.value``` field for consistency with the use of value and amount elsewhere in the standard.

providerOrganization.title: Provider organization
providerOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization from which the funds in this transaction originate. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the ```transaction.payer``` field to resolve ambiguity arising from 'provider' being interpreted as relating to the goods or services procured rather than the flow of funds between the parties.

receiverOrganization.title: Receiver organization
receiverOrganization.description: The Organization Identifier for the organization which receives the funds in this transaction. Expressed following the Organizational Identifier standard - consult the documentation and the codelist.

deprecated.description: This field has been replaced by the ```transaction.payee``` field to resolve ambiguity arising from 'receiver' being interpreted as relating to the goods or services procured rather than the flow of funds between the parties.

name.description: The name of the party being referenced. This must match the name of an entry in the parties section.
name.title: Organization name

id.description: The id of the party being referenced. This must match the id of an entry in the parties section.
id.title: Organization ID

identifier.title: Primary identifier
identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.

deprecated.description: From version 1.1, organisations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and detailed legal identifier information should only be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

From version 1.1, organisations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and address information should only be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

From version 1.1, organisations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and additional identifiers for an organisation should be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers
additionalIdentifiers.description: (Deprecated outside the parties section) A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.

deprecated.description: From version 1.1, organisations should be referenced by their identifier and name in a document, and contact point information for an organisation should be provided in the relevant cross-referenced entry in the parties section at the top level of a release.

OrganizationReference.description: The id and name of the party being referenced. Used to cross-reference to the parties section
OrganizationReference.title: Organization reference

name.title: Common name
name.description: A common name for this organization or participant in the contracting process. The identifier object provides an space for the formal legal name, and so this may either repeat that value, or could provide the common name by which this organization is known. This field could also include details of the department or sub-unit involved in this contracting process.

id.description: The ID used for cross-referencing to this party from other sections of the release. This field may be built with the following structure {identifier.scheme}-{identifier.id}(-{department-identifier}).
id.title: Entity ID

identifier.title: Primary identifier
identifier.description: The primary identifier for this organization. Identifiers that uniquely pick out a legal entity should be preferred. Consult the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/) for the preferred scheme and identifier to use.

additionalIdentifiers.title: Additional identifiers
additionalIdentifiers.description: A list of additional / supplemental identifiers for the organization, using the [organization identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/identifiers/). This could be used to provide an internally used identifier for this organization in addition to the primary legal entity identifier.

roles.title: Entity roles
roles.description: The party's role(s) in the contracting process. Role(s) should be taken from the [partyRole codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#party-role). Values from the provided codelist should be used wherever possible, though extended values can be provided if the codelist does not have a relevant code.

details.description: Additional classification information about parties can be provided using partyDetail extensions that define particular properties and classification schemes.
details.title: Details

typeOfBuyer.title: Type of Buyer
typeOfBuyer.description: A value from the [typeOfBuyer codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#type-of-buyer). The type of buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms.

mainGeneralActivity.title: Main General Activity
mainGeneralActivity.description: A value from the [mainGeneralActivity codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#main-general-activity). The main general activity of the buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms which is taken from the United Nations Classification of the Functions of Government (COFOG) codelist.

mainSectoralActivity.title: Main Sectoral Activity
mainSectoralActivity.description: A value from the [mainSectoralActivity codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#main-sectoral-activity) The main sectoral activity of the buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms which is taken from the United Nations Classification of the Functions of Government (COFOG) codelist.

isACentralPurchasingBody.title: Is the organization a central purchasing body?
isACentralPurchasingBody.description: A true/false field to indicate whether the organization is a central purchasing body.

NUTSCode.title: NUTS Code
NUTSCode.description: The most detailed level of NUTS codes, NUTS 3 should be used and it should be taken from the EU codelist linked from http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/index.cfm?TargetUrl=DSP_PUB_WELC.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: For commercial organization's, is this a micro (micro), Small or Medium Enterprise (sme) or large (large) entity according to the definitions used by the procuring entity or buyer. This field can be left blank if no such concepts apply.

buyerProfile.title: Buyer Profile URI
buyerProfile.description: For buyer organisations only: the url of the organization's buyer profile. Specified by the EU

Item.title: Item
Item.description: A good, service, or work to be contracted.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier to reference and merge the items by. Must be unique within a given array of items.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the goods, services to be provided.

classification.title: Classification
classification.description: The primary classification for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) to identify preferred classification lists, including CPV and GSIN.

additionalClassifications.title: Additional classifications
additionalClassifications.description: An array of additional classifications for the item. See the [itemClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) codelist for common options to use in OCDS. This may also be used to present codes from an internal classification scheme.

unit.title: Unit
unit.description: A description of the unit in which the supplies, services or works are provided (e.g. hours, kilograms) and the unit-price. For comparability, an established list of units can be used.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of a single unit.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list from which units of measure identifiers are taken. This should be an entry in the [unitClassificationScheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#unit-classification-scheme) codelist. Use of the scheme 'UNCEFACT' for the UN/CEFACT Recommendation 20 list of 'Codes for Units of Measure Used in International Trade' is recommended.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier from the codelist referenced in the scheme property. For example, with UNCEFACT, this is the value of the 'Common Code' column. From this identifier, applications can look-up the human readable name or symbol for this unit of measure.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: If the scheme used provide a machine-readable URI for this unit of measure, this can be given.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: If this item belongs to a lot, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.

id.description: An identifier for this amendment: often the amendment number
id.title: ID

description.description: A free text, or semi-structured, description of the changes made in this amendment.
description.title: Description

amendsReleaseID.description: Provide the identifier (release.id) of the OCDS release (from this contracting process) that provides the values for this contracting process **before** the amendment was made.
amendsReleaseID.title: Amended release (identifier)

releaseID.description: Provide the identifier (release.id) of the OCDS release (from this contracting process) that provides the values for this contracting process **after** the amendment was made.
releaseID.title: Amending release (identifier)

changes.title: Amended fields
changes.description: An array change objects describing the fields changed, and their former values.

property.title: Property
property.description: The property name that has been changed relative to the place the amendment is. For example if the contract value has changed, then the property under changes within the contract.amendment would be value.amount.

former_value.title: Former Value
former_value.description: The previous value of the changed property, in whatever type the property is.

deprecated.description: A free-text or semi-structured string describing the changes made in each amendment can be provided in the amendment.description field. To provide structured information on the fields that have changed, publishers should provide releases indicating the state of the contracting process before and after the amendment.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: An classification should be drawn from an existing scheme or list of codes. This field is used to indicate the scheme/codelist from which the classification is drawn. For line item classifications, this value should represent an known [Item Classification Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#item-classification-scheme) wherever possible.

id.title: ID
id.description: The classification code drawn from the selected scheme.

description.title: Description
description.description: A textual description or title for the code.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the code. In the event individual URIs are not available for items in the identifier scheme this value should be left blank.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: Organization identifiers be drawn from an existing identification scheme. This field is used to indicate the scheme or codelist in which the identifier will be found. This value should be drawn from the [Organization Identifier Scheme](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#organization-identifier-scheme).

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier of the organization in the selected scheme.

legalName.title: Legal Name
legalName.description: The legally registered name of the organization.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to identify the organization, such as those provided by [Open Corporates](http://www.opencorporates.com) or some other relevant URI provider. This is not for listing the website of the organization: that can be done through the url field of the Organization contact point.

Address.title: Address
Address.description: An address. This may be the legally registered address of the organization, or may be a correspondence address for this particular contracting process.

streetAddress.title: Street address
streetAddress.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

locality.title: Locality
locality.description: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

countryName.title: Country name
countryName.description: The country name. For example, United States.

ContactPoint.title: Contact point
ContactPoint.description: An person, contact point or department to contact in relation to this contracting process.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the contact person, department, or contact point, for correspondence relating to this contracting process.

email.title: Email
email.description: The e-mail address of the contact point/person.

telephone.title: Telephone
telephone.description: The telephone number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.

faxNumber.title: Fax number
faxNumber.description: The fax number of the contact point/person. This should include the international dialling code.

url.title: URL
url.description: A web address for the contact point/person.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency for each amount should always be specified using the uppercase 3-letter currency code from ISO4217.

startDate.title: Start date
startDate.description: The start date for the period.

endDate.title: End date
endDate.description: The end date for the period.

maxExtentDate.description: The period cannot be extended beyond this date.
maxExtentDate.title: Maximum extent

durationInDays.description: The maximum duration of this period in days. Where a start and end date are given, this field is optional, and should reflect the difference between those two days.
durationInDays.title: Duration (days)

RelatedProcess.description: A link to a related contracting process in OCDS and the type of relationship.
RelatedProcess.title: Related Process

id.title: Relationship ID
id.description: A local identifier for this relationship, unique within this array.

relationship.description: Specify the type of relationship using the [related process codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#related-process).
relationship.title: Relationship

title.description: The title of the related process, where referencing an open contracting process, this field should match the tender/title field in the related process.
title.title: Related process title

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The identification scheme used by this cross-reference from the [related process scheme codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/codelists/#related-process-scheme) codelist. When cross-referencing information also published using OCDS, an Open Contracting ID (ocid) should be used.

identifier.description: The identifier of the related process. When cross-referencing information also published using OCDS, this should be the Open Contracting ID (ocid).
identifier.title: Identifier

uri.description: A URI pointing to a machine-readable document, release or record package containing the identified related process.
uri.title: Related process URI

BidsStatistic.title: Bid Statistic
BidsStatistic.description: For reporting aggregate statistics about the bids related to a tender. Where lots are in use, statistics may optionally be broken down by lot.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for this statistical item.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: An item from the bidStatistics codelist for the statisic reported in value.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the tender process. This field can be left blank unless either (a) the same statistic is provided from multiple points in time, or (b) there is a specific local requirement for the data when statistics were calculated to be provided.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value for the measure in question. Total counts should be provided as an integer. Percentages should be presented as a proportion of 1 (e.g. 10% = 0.1)

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes required to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedLot.title: Related Lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are in use, if this statistic relates to bids on a particular lot, provide the lot identifier here. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole tender.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Summary statistics on the number and nature of bids received. Where information is provided on individual bids, these statistics should match those that can be calculated from the bid details array.

details.title: Bid details
details.description: An array of bids, providing information on the bidders, and where applicable, bid status, bid values and related documents. The extent to which this information can be disclosed varies from jurisdiction to jurisdiction.

Bid.title: Bid
Bid.description: For representing a bid in response to the tender or qualification stage in this contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for this bid

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when this bid was received.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the bid, drawn from the bidStatus codelist

tenderers.title: Tenderer
tenderers.description: The party, or parties, responsible for this bid. This should provide a name and identifier, cross-referenced to an entry in the parties array at the top level of the release.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of the bid.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the bid and its evaluation.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: If this bid relates to one or more specific lots, provide the identifier(s) of the related lot(s) here.
relatedLots.NOTE: Compare againt lotValues approach in open procument API - http://api-docs.openprocurement.org/en/latest/lots.html

requirementResponses.TODO: ADD REQUIREMENT RESPONSE SECTION TO REQUIREMENTS EXTENSION

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLot references at the item, document and award level.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot based on the [tenderStatus codelist](http://ocds.open-contracting.org/standard/r/1__0__0/en/schema/codelists#tender-status)

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated value of this lot.

options.title: Lot options
options.description: Details about lot options: if they will be accepted and what they can consist of. Required by the EU

recurrentProcurement.title: Recurrent Procurement
recurrentProcurement.description: Details of possible recurrent procurements and their subsequent calls for competition.

variants.title: Lot variants
variants.description: Details about lot variants: if they will be accepted and what they can consist of. Required by the EU

LotDetails.title: Lot Details
LotDetails.description: If this tender is divided into lots, details can be provided here of any criteria that apply to bidding on these lots. This extended property is currently focussed on fields required by the EU TED data standard

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier may bid for as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that may be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots may appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated value of the lots in this group. This may be lower than the sum total of lot values

type.title: Fee type
type.description: A fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees may apply for access to bidding documents, for the submission of bids or there may be a win fee payable by the successful bidder.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional information about the way in which fees are levied, or the exact nature of the fees.

methodOfPayment.title: Method(s) of payment
methodOfPayment.description: Optional information about the way in which fees can be paid.

Criterion.title: Criterion
Criterion.description: A criterion on which either bidders or items will be judged, evaluated or assessed.

id.description: The identifier for this criterion. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.description: Criterion description

source.description: Source of response to the requirements specificed in the criterion, for example responses may be submitted by tenderers or by an assessment committee at the procuringEntity.

relatesTo.description: The schema element that the criterion judges, evaluates or assesses. For example criterion may be defined against items or against bidders.

relatedItem.description: Where relatesTo = "item" this field must be populated with the id of the item in this tender section which the criterion relates to. Where relatesTo <> "item" this field should be omitted

requirementGroups.title: Requirement groups
requirementGroups.description: A list of requirement groups for this Criterion. A criterion is satisfied by one or more requirement groups being met. A requirement group is met when all requirements in the group are satisfied.

RequirementGroup.title: Requirement group
RequirementGroup.description: A requirement group is a set of requirements that must be fulfilled together to validate a criterion.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement group. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.description: Requirement group description

requirements.title: Requirements
requirements.description: A list requirements which must all be satisified for the requirement group to be met.

Requirement.title: Requirement
Requirement.description: An atomic requirement. Requirements can specify the expected value that the response has to contain, or a range of threshold values within which the response has to fit in. The requirement may apply to a certain period of time

id.description: The identifier for this requirement. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.description: Requirement description

pattern.description: A regular expression against which validate the requirement response

expectedValue.description: Used to state the requirement when the response must be particular value

minValue.description: Used to state the lower bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

maxValue.description: Used to state the upper bound of the requirement when the response must be within a certain range

period.description: Used to specify a particular period the requirement applies to, for example the bidder's turnover in a given year

RequirementResponse.title: Requirement Response
RequirementResponse.description: An assertion that responds to a single requirement. A requirement response provides the value for the requirement and may provide the period to which it applies.

id.description: The identifier for this requirement response. It must be unique and cannot change within the Open Contracting Process it is part of (defined by a single ocid). See the [identifier guidance](http://standard.open-contracting.org/latest/en/schema/identifiers/) for further details.

description.description: Requirement response description

value.description: Requirement response value. The value must be of the type defined in the requirement.dataType field

period.description: The period which the requirement response is applicable to

requirement.title: Related requirement
requirement.description: The id and title of the requirement which the response is applicable to

relatedTenderer.title: Related tenderer
relatedTenderer.description: Where this requirement response relates to a tenderer and is provided by the buyer or procuring entity this field should be used to reference the entry in the parties section for the tenderer the response relates to.

RequirementReference.title: Requirement reference
RequirementReference.description: Used to cross reference a requirement

id.title: Requirement ID
id.description: The id of the requirement which the response is applicable to

title.title: Requirement title
title.description: The title of the requirement which the response is applicable to

buyerProcedureReview.title: Award buyer procedure review
buyerProcedureReview.description: A True/False field to indicate if an economic operator applied to the buyer for a review of the procedure. Required by the EU

reviewBodyChallenge.title: Award review body challenge
reviewBodyChallenge.description: A True/False field to indicate if an economic operator or another party challenged the procedure before a review body. Required by the EU

legalProcedures.title: Award legal procedures review
legalProcedures.description: Identifier(s) of any review procedure(s) initiated. Required by the EU

id.title: Legal Proceeedings id
id.description: Legal identifier(s) of any review procedure(s) initiated. Required by the EU

title.title: Legal Proceeedings Title
title.description: Title(s) of any legal proceedings(s) initiated.

uri.title: Legal Proceeedings uri
uri.description: Legal identifier(s) of any review procedure(s) initiated.

projectIdentifier.title: Project Identifier
projectIdentifier.description: National identifier of the EU project providing partial or full funding

projectName.title: Project Name
projectName.description: Name or other national identification of the project providing full or partial funding.

uri.title: Project uri
uri.description: Uri of the project providing full or partial funding.

ValueBreakdown.title: Value Breakdown
ValueBreakdown.description: The breakdown of known and/or estimated values in this contract.

id.title: id
id.description: The identifier of this value breakdown. Unique within this array.

type.title: type
type.description: A value from the [valueType codelist] (http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#value-type) that identifies the nature of the value in the breakdown. Negative values indicate a revenue to the supplier.

description.title: description
description.description: The description of this value breakdown.

amount.title: amount
amount.description: The amount of this value breakdown. A positive value represents a transaction from buyer to supplier. A negative value represents a payment from the supplier to the buyer.

estimationMethod.title: Estimation Method
estimationMethod.description: The estimation method of this value breakdown, where applicable.

hasOptions.title: Lot Options
hasOptions.description: A True/False field to indicate if lot options will be accepted. Required by the EU

optionDetails.title: Lot option details
optionDetails.description: Further information about the lot options that will be accepted. Required by the EU

isRecurrent.title: Is recurrent?
isRecurrent.description: A True/False field to indicate whether this is a recurrent procurement

dates.title: Dates
dates.description: Estimated date(s) for subsequent call(s) for competition

description.title: description
description.description: Any further information about subsequent call(s) for competition.

hasRenewals.title: Has renewals?
hasRenewals.description: A True/False field to indicate whether contract renewals are allowed.

maxNumber.title: Maximum number
maxNumber.description: Maximum number of renewals of this lot

renewalConditions.title: Renewal Conditions
renewalConditions.description: Conditions for, and descriptions of, any renewals of this lot

hasVariants.title: Lot Variants
hasVariants.description: A True/False field to indicate if lot variants will be accepted. Required by the EU

variantDetails.title: Lot variant details
variantDetails.description: Further information about the lot variants that will be accepted. Required by the EU

reducesTimeLimits.title: Reduces Time Limits?
reducesTimeLimits.description: A True/False field to indicate whether this notice aims at reducing time limits for the receipt of tenders

isACallForCompetition.title: Is A Call For Competition?
isACallForCompetition.description: A True/False field to indicate whether this notice is a call for competition

socialOrOtherSpecificServices.title: Is For Social Or Other Specific Services?
socialOrOtherSpecificServices.description: A True/False field to indicate whether this notice is for social or other specific services

RelatedNotice.title: Related notice
RelatedNotice.description: Information that connects a notice with another notice within the same procurement procedure

scheme.title: Identifier scheme
scheme.description: The source of the related notice identifier. Currently only 'TED' and 'national' are permitted values.

id.title: id
id.description: The identifier of the related national notice.

objectOfProcurementInPIN.title: Object of the procurement within the PIN
objectOfProcurementInPIN.description: If the related notice linked to is a planning or 'Prior Information Notice' (PIN) that describes a number of potential tenders, the identifier of the specific Object to which this current contracting process relates should be given.

isAcceleratedProcedure.title: is Accelerated Procedure?
isAcceleratedProcedure.description: A True/False field to indicate whether an accelerated procedure has been used for this procurement

acceleratedProcedureJustification.title: Accelerated Procedure Justification
acceleratedProcedureJustification.description: Justification for using an accelerated procedure

hasPrizes.title: Tender design contest has prizes
hasPrizes.description: A True/False field to indicate if the design contest has prizes. Required by the EU

Prizes.title: Tender prizes
Prizes.description: Details about the prize(s) for the winner(s) of the design contest. Required by the EU

paymentsToParticipants.title: Tender payments to participants
paymentsToParticipants.description: Details of any payments that will be made to participants in the design contest. Required by the EU

serviceContractAward.title: Tender service contract award
serviceContractAward.description: A True/False field to indicate whether a service contract will be awarded to the winner(s) of the design contest. Required by the EU

juryDecisionBinding.title: Tender design contest jury decision binding
juryDecisionBinding.description: A True/False field to indicate whether the jury decision of the design contest is binding. Required by the EU

juryMembers.title: Tender design contest jury members
juryMembers.description: A list of the jury members for of the design contest. Required by the EU

participants.title: Tender design contest participants
participants.description: A list of the pre-selected participants for the design contest. Required by the EU

useOrdering.title: Tender uses electronic ordering
useOrdering.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic ordering will be used. Required by the EU

usePayment.title: Tender uses electronic payment
usePayment.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic payment will be used. Required by the EU

acceptInvoicing.title: Tender accepts electronic invoicing
acceptInvoicing.description: A True/False field to indicate if electronic invoicing will be accepted. Required by the EU

isJointProcurement.title: Is A Joint Procurement
isJointProcurement.description: A True/False field to indicate if this is a joint procurement or not. Required by the EU

country.title: Country
country.description: ISO Country Code of the country where the law applies. Use ISO Alpha-2 country codes.

types.title: Types of tender objectives
types.description: Contract performance conditions with environmental, social and innovative objectives. Required by the EU.

additionalInformation.title: Tender objectives additional information
additionalInformation.description: Further details about the objectives of the procurement. Required by the EU

procedureOutsourced.title: procedureOutsourced
procedureOutsourced.description: A True/False field to indicate whether the procurement procedure has been outsourced

outsourcedTo.title: Outsourced To
outsourcedTo.description: An organization reference to identify the organization that is running the outsourced procedure

DynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic Purchasing System
DynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Dynamic Purchasing System: Whether a dynamic purchasing system has been set up and if so whether it may be used by buyers outside the notice. Required by EU.

hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Has Dynamic Purchasing System?
hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.description: A True/False field to indicate whether a Dynamic Purchasing System has been set up.

hasOutsideBuyerAccess.title: Has Outside Buyer Access?
hasOutsideBuyerAccess.description: A True/False field to indicate whether the Dynamic Purchasing System may be used by buyers outside the notice.

noFurtherContracts.title: No Further Contracts?
noFurtherContracts.description: A True/False field to indicate whether no further contracts will be awarded in this dynamic purchasing system.

Framework.title: Framework
Framework.description: The details of any framework agreement established as part of this procurement. Required by EU.

isAFramework.title: Is A Framework?
isAFramework.description: A True/False field to indicate whether a framework agreement has been established as part of this procurement

typeOfFramework.title: Type of Buyer
typeOfFramework.description: A value from the [typeOfFramework codelist](http://standard.open-contracting.org/1.1-dev/en/schema/codelists/#type-of-framework). The type of buyer taken from the EU's specified list in its TED forms.

maxSuppliers.title: Maximum suppliers
maxSuppliers.description: Maximum number of economic operators to be awarded a contract

exceptionalDurationRationale.title: Exceptional Duration Rationale
exceptionalDurationRationale.description: Justification when the framework agreement has an exceptional duration.

additionalBuyerCategories.title: Additional Buyer Categories
additionalBuyerCategories.description: Any additonal categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned in the buyer section of this notice

PlaceOfPerformance.title: Place of Performance
PlaceOfPerformance.description: The address, NUTS code and further description of the place where the contract will be performed

address.title: address
address.description: Address for the place of performance of the contract.

description.title: description
description.description: Further description of the place of performance of the contract. Required by EU.

NUTScode.title: NUTS code
NUTScode.description: NUTS code for the place of performance of the contract.

placeOfPerformance.title: Place of Performance
placeOfPerformance.description: The address, NUTS code and further description of the place where the contract will be performed

Enquiry.title: Place of Performance
Enquiry.description: Enquiry to tender, with fields for a question, and an answer.

id.title: id
id.description: A unique identifier for the enquiry.

date.title: Enquiry Date
date.description: The date the enquiry was received or processed.

author.title: Enquiry author
author.description: The identifier and name of the party asking this question. Questioners may be listed in the parties array with a role of enquirer. Procurement policies vary on whether or not the identity of those asking questions should be disclosed, or at which stage this information may be disclosed. When the identity of the questioner cannot be disclosed leave the author section blank. Display systems should interpret this as an anonymous question.

title.title: Enquiry title
title.description: The subject line of the question.

description.title: Enquiry description
description.description: The body of the question.

answer.title: Enquiry answer
answer.description: The answer to this question, when available.

dateAnswered.title: Enquiry date of answer
dateAnswered.description: The date the answer to the question was provided.

relatedItem.title: Enquiry related item
relatedItem.description: If this question relates to a specific line-item, this field contains the line-item identifier.

relatedLot.title: Enquiry related lot
relatedLot.description: Where lots are used, if this question relates to a specific lot, this field contains the lot identifier.

threadID.title: Enquiry thread ID
threadID.description: If this question and answer forms part of a discussion thread (e.g. the question is a follow up to a previous answer) an optional thread identifier can be used to associate together multiple enquiries.

Author.title: Author
Author.description: The identifier and name of the party asking this question.

id.title: Author id
id.description: A unique identifier for the author.
